physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Widespread small aphthous pustular lesions (2 to 5 mm) with central ulceration and erythema and elevation on the periphery.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Five days after the initial observation, all lesions had regressed and disappeared without any scarring.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient felt dampness underneath the splint; widespread small aphthous pustular lesions observed.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Lesions regressed and disappeared five days later.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient showed a satisfying external appearance and a good nasal airway.
